keyPolicies.policyDescription: Intervened after learning maternity unit had closed several times due to staff shortages; his actions led to recruitment of four additional midwives.
Secured grants for Parbold Youth Club and the Birchwood Centre in Skelmersdale.
Conservatives will raise the state pension in line with earnings, protect winter fuel payments and have more efficient and personalized health and social care.
Adrian supports regeneration efforts, such as bringing Shadow Housing Minister to Skelmersdale to address challenges.
As chairman of governors at a Parbold primary school, he wants to see better school discipline and improved standards.

issues.education: Chairman of governors at a Parbold primary school, focused on better school discipline and improved standards.
issues.health: Intervened to address staff shortages at maternity unit, leading to recruitment of four additional midwives; supports personalized health and social care.
issues.socialWelfare: Will raise the state pension in line with earnings and protect winter fuel payments.

housing.content: Brought Shadow Housing Minister to Skelmersdale to discuss regeneration challenges.

leaflet.personalStatement: Adrian Owens has a record of action locally. He was selected as Conservative parliamentary candidate in 2007 by 150 local people and has since then built further on his role as a local councillor.

politicalExperience.achievements: Focused on better school discipline and improved standards.
Successful fight to save Newburgh Post Office, working with parish councillors and the local community.

images.caption: Adrian with Birchwood residents, Chelsea and Chris.
Adrian brought Shadow Housing Minister, Grant Shapps, to Skelmersdale.
Adrian with an elderly resident discussing health and social care.
Adrian at a meeting with Shadow Schools Secretary, Michael Gove, and local primary school headteachers.

leaflet.additionalNotes: Adrian lives in Newburgh Village where he played a part in the successful fight to save Newburgh Post Office.
